solution.text:
Let \(\frac{a}{r},a,ar\) be the first three terms of the G.P
\( \frac{a}{r} + a + ar =_{{p + p*q + p*q**2 }}_ .......(1)\)
\((\frac{a}{r})(a)(ar)=_{{(p**3)*(q**3) }}_ .......(2)\)
From (2), we obtain
\(a^3=_{{(p**3)*(q**3) }}_\)
=> \(a=_{{p*q}}_\)
Substituting a = 1 in equation (1), we obtain
\(\frac{_{{p*q}}_}{r} + _{{p*q}}_ + _{{p*q}}_r =_{{p + p*q + p*q**2 }}_\)
\(_{{p*q}}_ + _{{p*q}}_r + _{{p*q}}_r^2 =_{{p + p*q + p*q**2 }}_r\)
\(_{{p*q}}_ + _{{p*q}}_r + _{{p*q}}_r^2 -_{{p + p*q + p*q**2 }}_r=0\)
\(_{{p*q}}_r^2 - _{{p + p*q**2 }}_r + _{{p*q}}_=0\)
Solving this we will get the common ratio
\(r = _{q}_ ,\frac{1}{_{q}_}\)

content.text: Sum of first 3 terms of a G.P. is _{{p + p*q + p*q**2 }}_ and their product is _{{(p**3)*(q**3) }}_. Find the common ratio.
